channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Fremantle coach Justin Longmuir believes it is "unrealistic" to expect AFL players will return to full training at their clubs before June.
item.title: 'Unrealistic': Longmuir doubts AFL players will return to clubs before June

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Western United are trying to set up a deal to play their home games in a different venue than GMHBA Stadium, but the COVID-19 chaos has made it impossible so far.
item.title: Pandemic preventing Western United from tying up new ground share deal

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: death toll stands at 6 and national cabinet meets today

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: "It was horrible having to finish the picture after the men were lost."
item.title: Artist's picture of missing airmen on Anzac stamp 'like painting ghosts'

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Donald Trump to suspend immigration into US as COVID-19 economic fallout hits Virgin Australia, oil price, Australian death toll at 71

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: “It really dawned on me when team members were being made redundant."
item.title: How an employee feels about Virgin having its wings clipped

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The fantasy club at QUT has become an isolation lifeline for its 400 student members this semester.
item.title: Dungeons, dragons and real-life risks for students in social isolation

item.description: Trump acknowledged that global demand for oil has plummeted. "The problem is nobody's driving a car, anywhere in the world, essentially," he said.
item.title: Amid oil price plunge, Trump says he will add to oil reserves

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Katter’s Australian Party leader Robbie Katter and his wife Daisy welcomed their first child at Mount Isa, where they both live, on Monday morning.
item.title: Little Katter cutie leaves daddy Robbie sobbing

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: The Opposition has criticised a plan by WA Labor to raise much-needed campaign cash from taxpayer-funded state government political staffers ahead of the 2021 election.
item.title: Harvey rubbishes Labor plan to press taxpayer-funded political staff for campaign cash

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Unleaded petrol prices are expected to fall another 20 cents for motorists in Melbourne, as demand for oil dries up and US prices drop below US$0.
item.title: Petrol prices at Melbourne pumps expected to keep falling

item.dc:creator: John Bailey
item.description: Expat artist Jess Johnson's carefully structured world-building finds eerie parallels in the strange new rules of her life in New York.
item.title: Taking control: art under New York's lockdown

item.description: President says he will be signing an executive order to temporarily suspend immigration into the United States.
item.title: 'Invisible enemy': Trump to suspend immigration due to virus

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Mr Baird has been repeatedly touted as a Liberal Party contender for Warringah. This September, however, he takes the reins of HammondCare.
item.title: Former NSW premier Mike Baird to lead aged care charity

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Deputy Commissioner Shane Patton said 14 per cent of family violence calls made to police in the past month were directly related to COVID-19.
item.title: 'Closed doors won't protect you': Police ramp up response to family violence

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Heavy delays on Tuesday morning after emergency services were called to a multi-vehicle collision on the freeway in Laverton about 5.50am.
item.title: Man dies in 'horrific' Princes Freeway collision between trucks, cars

item.dc:creator: Giselle Au-Nhien Nguyen
item.description: From alternative to heavy rock, jazz and operetta, our music critics review four new albums that have a multitude of tastes covered.
item.title: Melbourne band RVG's newest record is a welcome balm for our times

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Racing Victoria boss Giles Thompson hopes the sport can capitalise on its unique situation and gain extra exposure, and perhaps prompt a broadcasting bidding war.
item.title: Racing hopes Seven may boost winter coverage in absence of AFL

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: BHP's output of Australia's top export, iron ore, has held up so far but the spreading pandemic has forced it to lower targets for other commodities.
item.title: BHP flags 'sharp' drop in global demand as virus clouds commodities outlook

item.description: The North Korean leader underwent a "cardiovascular surgical procedure", according to a website that gathers information from informants.
item.title: Kim Jong-un's health status in question after surgery: report

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: Crowne Plaza has provided accommodation for up to 300 people returning to Melbourne from overseas, who are confined to their hotel rooms. One of them escaped.
item.title: Man escapes COVID-19 quarantine at Crowne Plaza, runs into police

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: The historic move of oil prices into negative territory is explained by simple arithmetic.
item.title: Oil price plunge shows Trump's deal with OPEC and Russia was hopelessly naive

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Six new cases of COVID-19 have been recorded in NSW in the 24 hours to 8pm on Monday, bringing the state's total to 2968.
item.title: Aged care cluster grows as NSW records six new coronavirus cases

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The truck driver suffered internal injuries and fractures. He was flown to Rockhampton Hospital by rescue helicopter.
item.title: Truck rollover leaves debris scattered across highway

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: He may have been late to the party, but new NRL chief executive Andrew Abdo considers himself a league man after a fateful Good Friday experience.
item.title: Interim NRL boss Andrew Abdo isn't planning to be a stop-gap measure

item.dc:creator: Daile Cross
item.description: One thing most WA experts can agree on is that there is some mixed messaging going on here.
item.title: The biggest call: WA parents left to wrestle with decision to send kids to school

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Republican governors, including in Georgia, are reopening gyms, churches, bowling alleys and hairdressers later this week despite COVID-19 cases still rising.
item.title: Trump-aligned states ready to reopen for business from this week

item.dc:creator: Daile Cross
item.description: The teachers' union says they would prefer a more managed approach with the gradual return of students once individual schools worked out what they could accommodate.
item.title: ‘No fixed plan’: WA teachers will have to roll with the punches

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: ChemCentre fibres expert Rees Powell is going through the eight 1996 Holden Commodore VS Series 1 station wagon carpet fibres allegedly found in Ciara Glennon's hair.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: Fibre expert moves to carpet fibres found in Ciara Glennon's hair

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The decision comes after the State Administrative Tribunal in 2018 found Mr Rayney guilty of professional misconduct for secretly recording his wife's conversations before her death, and then lying to a Magistrate about it.
item.title: Lloyd Rayney banned from practising law after losing five-year legal battle

item.description: It was an iconic photograph that made clear the Storm, while accepting the penalties, would fight their way back.
item.title: The moment that defined the Melbourne Storm, 10 years on

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: Virgin Australia has confirmed it has gone into voluntary administration as WA Health Minister Roger Cook thanks praises the West Australian community after the state recorded its first zero-case day in nearly nine weeks.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Virgin goes into voluntary administration as WA celebrates zero new cases

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: NSW students will go back to school one day a week from mid-May, with temperature checks and priority COVID testing for teachers
item.title: Full time schooling to resume term 3, beginning with one day a week in May

item.description: The Queen has evidently cultivated her own appearance and image over the years, using clothes to bolster her status as both the world's foremost head of state and a woman firmly rooted in the British countryside.
item.title: At 94, this is what the Queen's style reveals about her and us

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Treasurer Jackie Trad offered a three-year coal royalty freeze for big mining companies in May 2019, if they agreed to contribute $70 million.
item.title: Queensland regional fund sits at $0 a year after Trad promised it

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Queensland health authorities are scrambling to get on top of a cluster of coronavirus cases linked to an outbreak at a hospital laboratory in the far north of the state.
item.title: Fears of Cairns cluster after 5 hospital lab workers test positive

item.description: He may have 19 grand slam titles but when it comes to IT skills, Rafael Nadal crumbled under pressure.
item.title: Nadal finally meets his match: IT gremlins

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Developers Mirvac have revealed details of the next phase of its riverside Newstead development as the state government predicts an additional 20,000 residents in two decades.
item.title: New 25-storey apartment complex lodged for historic riverside Newstead

item.dc:creator: Carrie Fellner
item.description: Supermarkets that service people across hundreds of kilometres of NSW are still struggling to get the basics.
item.title: Empty shelves and clogged sewers as shortages hit regional NSW

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Retailing powerhouse Premier Investments has confirmed it will not reopen stores on Wednesday as initially planned.
item.title: Smiggle, Peter Alexander stores to stay closed until mid-May

item.dc:creator: Nicole Precel
item.description: COVID-19 may have stopped the Essendon-Collingwood Anzac Day blockbuster, but it won't stop the AFL's annual Anzac Day ceremony.
item.title: This Anzac Day a lone bugler will play the Last Post to an empty MCG

item.description: A highly contagious viral infection that could destroy Queensland's seafood industry has been detected again.
item.title: Prawn disease found yet again in Queensland

item.description: Dropbox privately paid top hackers to find bugs in software by the videoconferencing company Zoom, then pressed it to fix them.
item.title: How Dropbox, and Australian hackers, uncovered Zoom's biggest flaws

item.description: From a US rivalry with China to inequality to the decline of oil states, this pandemic is the Great Accelerator, according to a former UK foreign secretary/
item.title: Coronavirus is accelerating eight challenging mega trends

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 decline has extended to -1.47 per cent, below 5300 points. Only utilities are higher.
item.title: ASX declines 1.47pc with nearly all sectors in red

item.description: Insolvency experts move in, and Victoria confirms 7 new coronavirus cases.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Virgin Australia has confirmed it has gone into voluntary administration, handing the airline over the insolvency experts at Deloitte to restructure the business and find new owners to keep it flying.
item.title: Virgin Australia confirms collapse into administration
